page.title: 02St.Helen's church Kirmington
page.content: In a central position on the main street of Kirmington stands St.Helen's Church with it's 13th. Century ironstone tower,crowned by a copper on timber spire of 1838,a local landmark. The church was restored under the direction of S.S.Teulon in 1859.The nave retains its medieval arcades with some carved capitals. Further minor restoration has cont- inued and this year,1985 a Restoration Appeal Fund has been launched to raise Â£30,000 to re-roof the south aisle and renovate the Tower. Kirmington Church shares a Vicar,resident in Limber, with Croxton,Limber & Brocklesby.There is a weekly church service and an active Boys and Girls Brigade.An adult choir,who sing at special services,was formed in 1983. There is now no chapel but Methodist lay preachers are leading 1 service each month.
